localised_description: Spring arrives, and Britannia breaths new life into the land. Crops grow, commerce resumes, and armies march.
The height of summer: Peasants toil in the fields and bodies rot quickly under the summer sun.
Leaves drift down from the trees and the weather turns bitter. Peasants and Kings alike begin to prepare for the winter to come.
Winter comes, and frost grips the earth. Britannia sleeps while her people gather around their harths, braving the cold until Spring comes.
